Authors: Sardjono W., Mulianto P., Perdana W.G.
Title: Effect of ease of use, usefullness, cost effectiveness, and compatibility towards cloud computing usage in manufacturing company
Source title: International Journal of Recent Technology and Engineering
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Environmental Science, University of Indonesia, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sardjono, W., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mulianto, P., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Perdana, W.G., School of Environmental Science, University of Indonesia, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Cloud Computing technology can have benefit to company operation, but not all company implement Cloud computing especially in manufacturing company. Many factors effect the decision to use cloud computing technology, and this study analyze the effect of ease of use, usefulness, cost effectiveness, and compatibility towards cloud computing usage in manufacturing company. This study analyze the correlation between each factors toward the usage of technology using Technology Acceptance Theory (TAM), Diffusion of Innovation Theory (DOI) using Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and anova, a statistic method. The results of the study are ease of use, usefulness, cost effectiveness, and compatibility factors have effect and correlated to the usage of Cloud computing in manufacturing company. © BEIESP.
Author Keywords: Cloud Computing; Compatibility; Cost Effectiveness; DOI; Ease of Use; TAM; Usefulness
